description: A contextual extension of a Victorian house that redefines the inside-outside connection. The inside features selected framed views of the garden, and cherry joinery that contrasts with the stainless steel kitchen and concrete floor.

events.name: Drop in
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: Extension design
paragraphs: The project explores the inside-outside connection in a typical Victorian house. Large views frame the garden, while the interior materials are chosen to create an atmosphere that invites for contemplation. On the inside,  the solid cherry joinery contrasts with the concrete floors and stainless steel kitchen, while the stained brick extension quietly blends in with the surroundings.

travel_info: Additional travel info: The closest overground station is Rectory Road. Alternatively, there are several bus routes serving the area.

name: House extension in Stoke Newington
